Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student can draw a healthy plant that has water but may only show basic features like green leaves and a simple shape.
The student can draw an unhealthy or wilted plant without water, possibly showing droopy leaves or a less vibrant color.
CANNOT: The student might omit the sun or include it inconsistently, not fully understanding its importance for plant health (student may not know plants need light).
The student may not show a plant growing towards the light or may attempt this with incorrect placement (student unclear about the concept of phototropism).
The student might not label the healthy and unhealthy plants or might misunderstand labeling (student might mix up which plant is healthy or unhealthy).
